reviews.review_msg: Her lectures can be quite boring and she does have an accent but her midterm was only 5 written questions (of course with parts a,b,c,etc). I found the final much harder than the midterm and the group assignments are quite long but overall, pretty light class and I definitely recommend taking class with Devadrita

Very organized and easy to follow. Each lecture she provides practice questions with solutions and the exams are based off of those questions. She is very good at explaining concepts and shows all steps when demonstrating how to solve a problem.
Take 232 with her. Very straightforward, no bs, clear expectations and extremely fair grading and assignments. She makes a quantitative course easy. You'll regret not taking it with her.

Dr. Nair explains everything so well and is so kind and compassionate to students whenever they need help. She was always clear on expectations and provided a ton of helpful additional questions and detailed solutions. She deserves a more than a 5/5 and I highly recommend her to anyone in BUS.

Dr. Nair is one of the best instructors I've had at SFU (as I am in the second year). Her lectures are well organized and engaging, which makes complex concepts much easier to understand. She genuinely cares about students' success and is always willing and nice to answer any questions you have, whether in class, by email, or during office hours.

Dr Nair is such a caring professor, you will not regret taking her class. Her classes are easy and her midterms are short, and straightforward, if you study her lecture slides. She really cares for her students, and I'm so glad BUS232 got to be her first teaching experience at SFU! If I could, I would LOVE to take her classes again!

It is an honour to have such an inspiring lecture at SFU Beedie! She is the best part of my university experience; anyone who misses the chance to take courses with her will regret it forever! Highly recommended to you all!

Her lectures (recordings provided) are very useful, with clear explanations of concepts and exercises explained to students through interesting and super neat PowerPoint slides. Apart from the accent, she is amazing! Highly recommended!

She is super nice and kind! Her PPT slides are very beautiful and clearly labeled. Also, the details of the important concept points in the class are explained clearly and calmly. Zoom recordings are provided at the end of each class, as well as annotated in-class materials to help students to review!
This course made me want to cry every day, not because of the prof but because of stats.
One of the few professors who speak cohesively and finish the entire thought process. It was a fresh reminder that there are still proficient professors.

One of the best professors I've had! The way that she teaches makes all the concepts very simple and easy to understand. You can tell she wants everyone to do well. The midterm and exam are somewhat difficult, but if you practice the questions/problems she goes over during lecture, you'll do good. There's no surprises on exams, they're very fair.
Really engaging lectures and gave students time to ask questions. Rewarded class participation in the grade. The midterms were difficult.
She is a very organized professor and provides a very supportive learning environment to students.

Negar is great. Her lectures really do help understand the material, and she takes the time to explain more complicated concepts in detail. Super nice person, too. My only complaint is that she could be more careful with her wording/grammar on quizzes/assignments/exams. Sometimes it can be hard to understand what the question is really asking.

She is one of the best professors at SFU, and very very caring. The fact that the lectures are recorded goes to show how much she cares about the students, exams are very fair, and during the lectures, she will often explain and emphasize specific topics that will be tested in the midterm and final. She makes statistics so interesting and easy.

Very sweet and straight-forward professor. She was great at breaking down difficult concepts into easy-to-understand pieces. She lets you know exactly what will be on the midterm and final (no surprises). The course is tough but as long as you do the practice questions that she provides (along with the slide questions), it will be fine!
Very good prof nice lady, course is hard but if you go to class and listen it will be easy. She explains the course concepts very well and posts her lectures with tons of examples.

Negar is by far one of the best profs I've had at SFU. She really cares about her students and is always willing to give help. She encourages participation in her lectures and as a reward, it can boost your grade. The lectures were very straightforward and reliable for the exams. There are group assignments that are very beneficial for learning.

genuinely negar is the best math professor i have ever had in my entire life. she explains concepts very clearly, gives you a complete list of what she will ask you on midterms and finals, and gives opportunity to get extra marks if you ask questions in her class. she is also very organized and has good structure. highly recommend she is so good!

She is one of my favourite profs at SFU. Her lectures were very informative and she went through all of the concepts in great detail. If anyone had any questions, she wouldn't hesitate to go back and re-explain until you had a good understanding. She's very knowledgable in the subject, and therefore made an amazing teacher. She made stats enjoyable
She is a decent prof, atleast she records the lectures so you can listen to them on 2x speed. Exams are very very long but not necessarily hard. Classes are not worth going and rather boring.

She's a great professor and makes difficult information very easy to digest.  She doesn't mind repeating herself and changing how she explains something.  She's flexible with deadlines as well.  Very caring, patient and passionate.  100% would recommend.

Negar is a caring prof who does her best to make hard course material easy to learn. Her tests are clear and similar to the practice questions from lectures. the group projects can be rough if you dont choose ur group mates carefully. read the instructions for the projects thoroughly and be sure to get help in office hours.

she records all her lectures, goes over multiple examples that are similar to exam questions, answers any questions asked during lectures/office hours and final is non cumulative. She's very understanding and nice to students, the only thing is she doesn't respond to emails and there's not enough time during exams, otherwise she's a great prof!

Really great prof. She starts every lecture with 30 minutes of review from last class with problems, which helps to remember previous material. She does a ton of practice problems in class and explains them well. Midterm and final were not that difficult because she gives you a comprehensive formula sheet, literally just plug numbers in.
Really cares about her students success. Half of the lectures are spent going over practice questions and make studying super easy.

Lectures themselves are quite helpful and negar is very good at explaining all the  concepts. Lectures are recorded. 4 in class quizzes and 5 assignments which were all based on what we learned in class. Midterm and final were both fair. As long as you practice questions and go over all the concepts, you should do well in this class!

I had to retake Bus 232 because I had a D. My last teacher was a math lecturer and did not try to explain statistics in a relevant way to our class. 
Negar was an excellent teacher, focusing on the usage of statistics and other functions in excel. It helped me a lot in my Co-op where I had to do a lot of data work.

Negar is a great professor, the way she explains concepts is so easy to understand and the examples she goes over are super helpful!!! She seems like she is really passionate about her subject and very knowledgeable as well. I highly recommend her BUS 232 class

Amazing prof. Attend the lectures because she goes through the material very thoroughly with lots of examples and ensures that you understand it well. It would be difficult to figure it out on your own, so make sure to pay attention. She helps if you have questions. She's very helpful during her office hours. One of the best profs I've had at SFU.
Makes a lot of spelling mistakes and calculation errors but other than that she was fine.
She is a great prof who genuinely cares about her students. Her lectures are engaging and easy to follow. Quizzes, exams, and assignments are fair.
Professor negar is really good at teaching and genuinely cares about the students wellbeing. Also very forgiving if you genuinely made a mistake. Would definitely take her courses if possible

Lecture is recorded, and there are 5 in person quizzes that she basically shows you how to do in the previous lecture, very kind prof however you have to know what youre doing for those quizzes cuz theyre 30 mins which is barley enough time to write everything down. exams MC is difficult however written she tells you in class what she expects

First professor I actually like. Explains everything so well and answers questions when you're struggling. She tells you basically everything that will be on the quizzes, and the type of questions on the midterm and final. Assignments, quizzes, and problem solutions are posted almost immediately. Take her classssss
I didn't officially have Negar as a professor but she answered questions and helped me with my stats 270 class more than my own professor

Negar is an absolute gem of a professor. I was so anxious to undertake this statistics course, however she provided the utmost support and guidance from the start to ensure the material was understood and easily grasped. Her exams were very fair and the assignments are a massive help to prepare. Overall definitely one of the best professors at SFU!

She was very helpful during office hours and put effort into making sure the concepts were clear. Her grading was very fair, and she genuinely cares about helping her students. She is a great prof and I hope to take future classes that she teaches.

She is a great prof as she does her best to help students succeed and is helpful with answering questions. Lectures are recorded so if you miss anything you can always just watch them. Just practice the in-class questions and try to keep up with the material, if you don't understand anything just ask her for help. Very nice and caring prof overall.
Clear lectures, nice and caring. explains very well.
The material is hard but she is willing to help if you ask, when I took it lectures were recorded and posted which helped and also be prepared to do the assignments in groups.
Assignments contain some grammar mistakes.  Nice and caring person.

Great lecturer with clear explanations. Very understanding grader when it comes to group conflicts and can tell she has a kind soul. Goes a bit fast but overall happy with my experience in her class thus far. Content is on the tougher side but keep up with lecture and content and you will be okay! Please take her for 232, you won't regret it.

She was a pretty nice prof, often showed explanations and walkthrough problems during lecture. Slides are pretty informative as to what to expect on exams and I would say it's really important to practice after lecture per week. If you don't understand something, review back on the lecture recordings as it helped me after 3 hours of lec.
AMAZING experience in her class. She is a great lecturer and cares for her students. Class requires a lot of practice to do well on tests. Take 232 with her!

Overall very kind professor, and gives good feedback. All of her exams are fair as she gives many hints for what to expect and if you zone out in class you can just watch the recordings which are extremely helpful. Take this course with your friends so you wont worry about having a bad group for the group work. 10/10 would recommend

Overall, she is a very kind person and explains everything really well. Lectures are recorded and being able to re-watch them helps a lot. The textbook is optional, but I recommend purchasing it for practice problem examples. No surprises on exams, but questions are on the difficult end. 

#1 tip for success: PRACTICE.

I recommend taking courses with her because she really cares for her students. She does a lot of examples in class, and answers questions in class. Very accessible outside of class as well because she arranges a time, if you are not available during office hours.

She makes BUS232 simple and easy to understand. She always asks if students understand topics taught, and provides recorded lectures in case you can't make it to class / want to rewatch the lecture. Her quizzes are fair and easy if you watch the lecture. Can be a little boring, but follow along and you'll be fine.
Professor Negar is a super nice and caring professors, 100% recommend.

She is a SUPER NICE prof. I can feel she loves teaching and she is very willing to help students and even give hints during the exam.

For those people who complain about her class recording. Remember it is your responsibility to attend the lecture, and class recording is NOT REQUIRED for the in-person class. COVID is over! Come to class!
Can you use better equipment when you record your lectures? Whenever you show your work that crap is 5 frames per second yet you do nothing to address the issue

Great prof, so glad she actually solved questions by hand in lecture and often asked us if we have any doubts regarding the same. It is really important for this course to understand how to solve questions as 232 is very content heavy. She records classes and also gives out practice questions often. Fair exams. Would take 336 with her too.
i like her
Awesome prof, who always like to help and answer students' questions. would definitely take her class in the future

Great prof. She knows the subject well and teaches it well too. Records lectures and wants to help students as much as she can. Fair exams too. Do not crib about the prof you arent ready to study for this content-heavy course. Group projects are good ways to increase your grade average as the course content can be too much. Final not cumulative.

She is a very nice person and cares about students. I have her for both Bus232 and Bus336, and I love her. However, her lecture is a bit boring. She records everything and posts it on Canvas. Her midterm and final were fair based on the lectures.

Prof doesn't understand what she's saying. Half the time I'm lost and I don't know what i'm learning. Please LOOK INTO FEEDBACK! Alots of my peers think the same and she needs to know herself because this is a joke..

I had Negar for both Bus232 and Bus336, in both classes she was very professional and organized. It's clear she cares about her students, and is extremely helpful after class or by email. Her lecture slide and in-class examples are super helpful for midterm/ final, she posts it all on her canvas page. It's also a non-cumulative final which is nice.
Awful in every category. Would highly NOT recommend

Most boring lectures of all time. Cannot understand half the words she says. Assignment are marked based on extremely vague criteria and assignment questions are worded extremely vague and in broken English.
Good prof. Responds quickly to emails and is helpful when help is needed.

Read the textbook and make sure you understand the problems she gives in class because the exam questions are very similar. She will tell you what you need to know if you ask, and is very upfront about what you need to do. She is always open to questions and if you demonstrate you want to learn, she will try her hardest to help you succeed.

The professor doesn't know how to teach at all and doesn't even know the course material itself. She rushes through the stuff without teaching a single thing properly. When someone asks any valid question regarding the course, most of the time she just answers with "I don't know" and moves on, without providing any clarification.

Negar has the potential to be a really good prof. She explains the concepts clearly, however, she does so blandly. In lecture, it was hard to pay attention due to the amount of seemingly repetitive problems. She does provide a good amount of material to study, but some of the solutions could have more detail to them.

Negar is a nice person who seems to genuinely care for her students, but her explanations and lectures were dry and ineffective. Slides sometimes had incorrect information, and assignment instruction sheets were vague, missing necessary information to answer questions. Pay attention in class, use YouTube, and do the practice questions.

Negar's lectures are incredibly hard to bear through as her accent makes it hard to understand what she is teaching. I advise to just read the textbook and master the content yourself instead as that is what worked for me. I went to only one or two lectures over the course of the semester. Just do practice problems and you will do well on the tests

She is a good person but her ability to teach is very poor. Her explanations made no sense and her slides/homework solutions were full of mistakes making it very difficult to study. The assignments were application problems in excel however none of her lectures connected to excel. Avoid her if you can.

Her in-person lectures are so boring and hard to follow along, especially as the first stats class for business students. Her slides are confusing and you can't follow along with what she is actually teaching. Slides, example questions, and homework have errors all over and she doesn't realize making it hard for students to follow along.

Terrible teaching style, she was really bad at explaining concepts, which was especially bad for a statistics course. She also consistently made mistakes when solving practice examples in class which caused even more confusion for students. Her lecture slides were even worse as they were either full of mistakes or made zero sense.

Horrible slides that looked like they were made decades ago, unclear and makes you confused. She is not good at explaining material and just reads off of the slides. her presentations are dry and have unclear explanations that just states facts like a highschooler. She is a good person but I can tell she lacks effort in her teachings and her slides

George was a pretty bad professor. He obviously doesn't take in any feedback from the previous semester or improve his teaching; we had the same issues as the semester before during exams. Uses the same lectures from previous terms even if there are mistakes. Slides disorganized and really dull. The curve is high so watch out. TAs are terrible too

The class was very disorganized. Assignments would take me 10 hours to finish because there were so many questions to do. Both midterm and final were poorly run and all multiple choice. Professor was not accessible and TAs were not very helpful either. I would not recommend this prof.

I did not enjoy prof Zhang. He taught the class asynchronously which was great because I could watch the lectures at 1.5x speed. Stats is already a bland, uninteresting topic for me and his lecture style did not help

His midterm was terrible - had 17 unanswerable questions cause the graphs were missing so he took them all out which made all the other questions worth so much more. The final was also a mess - prof and TAs were disorganized and unprofessional and refused to answer questions. The material itself is okay but the profs and TAs were just a mess

DO NOT TAKE HIM - he does not reply to emails at all - both his midterm and final had extreme technical difficulties - reuses notes and instructions from the previous semester resulting in lots of confusion about the logistics fo assignments and exams - he has sent out the wrong notes on multiple occasions - unlearned material on some assignments
Can you believe that for a math course, all assignments are required to be typed in Word instead of handwriting? This is ridiculous.
Good prof! Teaches content slowly but easy enough class. 6 assignments throughout the sem, if you can do them youre good.
Liking him :) He is not tough and he is super patient to answer students' comments. He explains the lecture so detailed but you might find his teaching is kinda slow. Assignments are due every week .

Really tough but fair. Caring but in a fatherly way. Formulaic but inspirational. Genuinely wants students to excel. Intimidating 1-to-1. Should: Take good notes. Ask questions, seek answers, never stop until satisfied. Practice, practice, practice. Stay curious and strong. Long live Frost Lord! -- Survivor of BUS 232: Intro to Statistical Tortures

Makes jokes, tells funny stories, and prepares students for real world challenges they could encounter in business. CURVED AT THE MEDIAN (C+) so be aware of that fact

Personally found the course difficult, but I'm also not the smartest student, so Andrew can't be blamed for that. Overall, Andrews a genuine guy and ridiculously smart prof. 10/10

BUS 232 wasn't that bad with Flostrand. He gives you a great idea of what will be on the final. The averages for our midterms and final were quite low though, in the failing territory...

He gives you plenty of time during lectures and spaces out content great.

Professor Flostrand is a good prof who gives very good lectures. The course is lecture heavy so make sure to pay attention and take notes. The prof pauses every once in a while to give you time to finish writing which is really nice. Make sure to get lots of practice since the final was really hard and worth quite a lot.

Flostrand's exam is absolutely brutal. He teaches really well but if you are not paying attention the whole time and doing a lot of practice outside of class time, this class is very difficult to pass. However, the mc and long answers were very difficult even for people who studied throughout the semester. Not worth taking him unless you know stats

Took this Spring 2021. Prof is good for all aspects except exam format and unfair marking scheme. We only see one question at a time and can't go back. That's tough for calculation type exam. Marking scheme for finals is brutal. First incorrect answer for the long calculations then you get zero for the rest. Avg for finals is 47% after scaling.

Had Andrew this past (Spring 21) semester and he really isn't all that bad. He's a great lecturer and sure his exams are unreasonably difficult but in a curved class this really doesn't matter. If you attend every lecture, understand his examples, do the homework yourself and do all the practice qs in the book you'll kill the curve.

I am about to graduate, and I have taken courses from many different instructors, and I have not seen a worse instructor than Mr. Flostrand. Most of his fangirls think he is the best because of the 'Frost Lord' meme. A must avoid if you do not want to learn useless theoretical knowledge on business stats.

Avoid if you can. Prof. Flostrand added a ton of anxiety and made this already-difficult course, much harder to endure. He takes a "guilty until innocent" approach towards his students during exams and assignments in regards to cheating. It was difficult to become invested in this course when Prof. Flostrand had 0 faith in us to begin with.

Lectures are great, and content is straightforward to follow through. Assignments are not too bad as well. Midterm and final are a bit harder than normal it seems like. Has a big thing against cheating, a big pain during midterm/final when taking online due to technical issues (lost a bunch of marks). I think he would be a fine prof in person.

I got A- and this was the worst course ive ever taken. Andrew would probably be a great prof in person  but online he is arrogant, rude, insincere, paranoid and tries to make everyones life a living hell. His narcissism and paranoia about cheating are insanely unreasonable. AVOID AT ALL COSTS! Wait until its in person if you can. Trust me.

This guy is so insecure about what people think of him he has resorted to writing positive reviews of himself. Overall, he knows how to teach and does a good job of explaining topics in lectures. However, this severe insecurity Andrew possesses, driven by an insane paranoia of students cheating his tests makes for a horribly designed final exam.

I have taken BUS 232 with Andrew twice already. The worst decision I ever made. Take it with someone else. Andrew is arrogant, incompetent, and making it unnecessarily difficult for students to do well in his class on purpose.

Even though I got an A in this class, this professor just tried his best to make everyone's life more miserable during the pandemic. I understand he did not want people to cheat but his paranoia about cheating was so much to the point it seemed like it was an unhealthy obsession that he had. Workload ramped up in end, don't take this prof.

I can see Andrew being a good prof in class, but online is clearly not his forte. 4 hour stats lectures were just disgusting. He's super paranoid about anyone cheating on his exam, but on both the final and the midterm there were technical issues that lead to even more time constraints. He makes the class leave their mics on during the exam.

A good professor who teaches the material well. Assignments are time consuming but not difficult. Exams can be a bit harsh though, especially in an online environment, and is slightly paranoid about cheating. You have to work hard to earn your grades with Andrew, if you slack off at any point during the semester, game over.

!AVOID! unavailable, unreliable, inconsistent, extremely unprofessional, incompassionate especially during a global pandemic, narcissistic. Completely disregards student's mental health, strong work ethics, and integrity. Good luck getting a response back from him bc he was VERY clear he WON'T be answering emails from day one to the end. !AVOID!

Paranoid about cheating and makes course extremely cumbersome and tedious to "catch the cheaters". Our midterm average ended up being 55% and for the final he introduced significant measures that were extremely hard to do to "prevent cheating". I think the 55% average shows there was very little if not any cheating.

Cares more about catching cheaters than actual learning. Very inconsistent and goes back on his word A LOT! His exams are more-so about tricking students with the English language, rather than business statistics. Very unfair, unapproachable, and simply not good at online teaching. AVOID AT ALL COSTS!!!!
Pretty much at every turn, trys to make the class harder for you
This prof give almost 1/3 more content than other prof and his exam is very hard. The assignment he gives is very hard and so much work to do!

The midterm exam wasn't meant to test how well students performed -- it was meant for Andrew's ego to get bigger. He doesn't allow students to email him. He wasted over 2 hours of our time on the midterm because the system crashed, and he never apologized! AVOID at all costs. I have learnt absolutely nothing in this course.
Great professor. I would dare to say, I think he is way better than Michael Johnson, you can see the passion Andrew has!!!
Dr Aboukinane is an excellent prof . She taught me statistics in a very simple way and feel now very familiar with the key concepts

She definitely wasn't the best prof in the world. She was very disorganized and provided no structure to her classes. However, she made her class very easy to pass. The midterm was fair and the final exam had the exact same questions as the practice problems we did in class.

She seems like a nice person but as a professor, she really let me down. This was the most unorganized class I've ever been in. She would say one thing and then not follow through on it. Directions were SO unclear. "Cumulative final exam" but was only on the first 5 chapters of the class. This is coming from someone who went to every class!
She does not provide any instruction regarding anything, not even the finals. she also doesn't reply to any on the mails you send her. pleaseee don't take her ever.
She doesn't reply to emails. And she is very unclear with her instructions and how she teaches, it's tough to catch up!! I really recommend not to take her class!!

Excellent! Very knowledgeable.I came out of her lectures a lot more confident . Not sure what my final mark will be but I thought that the midterm exam was very fair. I really liked her hands-on approach. Never skip her classes, you won't do well... She explains a lot during her sessions! I would definitely take classes again with her. Good luck!

Great prof ..If you attend classes, you will do well. Those who fall behind are those who rely on the textbook only. She goes beyond the textbook and bring real life examples in class . She simplifies difficult concepts ...Amazing teaching style. Would definitely take her class again.

I WISH I COULD FORMALLY COMPLAINT AGAINST HER. Absolutely WORST. Avoid her at all cost unless you want to be super duper stressed for just one class. Makes it so difficult for students. Her classes confused me even more.

She is the worst Professor I have had in SFU, unprofessional disorganized, will say something do something else, expects student to be free for whole week for her classes. Takes different online classes on the days classes are not scheduled and then expects us to be there. NEVER replies to students, doesn't explain properly. Wiley plus mandatory.

Extremely disorganized professor, doesn't respond to emails, Instructions and lectures are very confusing. Although lectures are scheduled for 2 hours, she will arrive 10 minutes late and give a very short lecture where she reads out slides copied from wileyplus. Expect lots of material near the end of term due to poor organization.

Chehra overall seems like a nice person to be around so it kind of sucks to leave a critical comment. But I would absolutely avoid her as a prof. Lectures are disorganized, Wileyplus (canvas clone costing 100$) is mandatory and she often does not respond to emails. Instructions are usually unclear and lectures confuse more than educate. Go next.

Really bad at teaching, but he did have a pretty fair grading scheme. You could choke the midterm or final and still recover because he made assignments and quizzes worth a lot. However, get ready to teach yourself.

I am A student and this is the only class where I get a C-. It's not my fault, Amir's way of teaching is trash and is English is unbearable. Without a doubt, the worst prof I had. He doesn't give sample midterms nor finals and never does practice problems on the board. Only goes through the slides and the solutions on it, but never does it himself.

Amir Azaron is the ABSOLUTE WORST professor I have ever had EVER. He never gives sample midterms or exams and doesn't even post the solutions with workings on them. HE SHOULD BE FIRED! I don't understand why SFU hires people like this. He doesn't care for students AND HIS ENGLISH IS SO BAD. Trust me on this one, don't take any classes with him.

This guy is the absolute worst professor I've ever taken. Has a THICK accent, Slides are garbage,Doesnt care for you and should 100% quit teaching. He can not explain concepts. His TAs do not know the material and his slides have conflicting formulas. Wouldnt give a sample final paper. Can you think of the worst qualities of a prof ? hehasit-2/10

Amir is one of the worst professors I've had during my time at SFU. He does not provide practice exams and expects us to get a high grade in the class. There was a lot of cheating between students in the class, where they had access to exams and quizzes beforehand, leading to many getting 100% and screwing others. Nothing was ever done about that.
not a reliable professor

The absolute worst prof. His accent is so thick it makes it almost impossible to understand what he is saying. His lecture slides do a terrible job of supporting the lesson info & he doesn't care about his students at all. His pop quizzes are atrocious and he repeats the basic concepts in round about ways but skims over the more complex theories.
Probably the worst prof I've had at SFU. Boring and tedious lectures, awful pop quizes, and just a rude guy. He spent almost the entire first class just reading his resume, as if any of us cared.
Easy A+, bro, he repeated easy things over and over to make sure people understand. Going to the class just for pop-up quiz.
DONT take stats with this professor. She does not explain anything well and you can barely understand her. I'm basically going to have to teach this entire course to myself.
40 something % avg on the midterm. Stats for the final were not released and honestly, I doubt it was much different than the midterm. Very demoralizing which drains your motivation to do well.

Cleusa has good lectures. She's very straight to the point and has examples to help you understand. The course itself can be very hard to understand at times due to the content. I appreciated her thorough walkthrough of using excel functions as many people haven't used it before. There is an overwhelming amount of formulas (hand written and excel).

The course isn't the worst but isn't great either, the midterm was extremely harder than usual, the average was around 46%. In order to succeed, you need to understand the concepts clearly and practice as much as you can. The group projects are worth a decent chunk so hope to get a good group. The professor seems caring as she made passing easier.
Knowledgeable and clear in the subjects. Heavy emphasis on both final and midterm exams. MC questions are challenging!
Very nice guy.

lectures are long and unhelpful. he leaves stuff out of the posted slides, so you should definitely attend class. the practice exam sample questions are only available in class, and your cheat sheet can't have graphs or notes. he didn't post an assignment/quiz so he made them optional. not the worst but disappointing considering he's a recent grad.
A good instructor for this course offers very standard lectures, exams, assignments, and quizzes.

He makes ZERO announcements about anything, ever. He posts quiz and assignment due dates for the morning of the lecture day, then without warning the next assignment and quiz are suddenly due a day earlier, then again the assignment and quiz due dates are due another day earlier. He makes zero effort to let us know any changes in the schedule

Nice enough guy and seems smart however is a terrible teacher. If you want to save yourself some time go to the first 2 lectures just so you can see for yourself how pointless it is. His slides and "examples" he uses in class are plagiarised (practically word for word). There's only a 350 character limit but to sum it up Chat GPT is a better teache

Hard to understand, makes content harder than needed. Very monotone and has been repeatedly told to raise voice in class which he blames on technical difficulties. He does try tho which I give him credit for.
Mehdi is a knowledgeable, organized, and easygoing professor.
Avoid.

Amazing teacher. He records his lectures and is really good at explaining the material. There was no final, just 2 midterms and they were not cumulative. Midterm's are pretty hard but he gives you a breakdown of what it includes so you know what to expect. Assignments helped a lot in boosting your grade & in preparing for midterms.
Liked his course. MC questions in both midterm and final exams are challenging.

He used clear examples to illustrate the concepts we were learning. was very patient and approachable for questions. Exams are very similar to the quizzes and assignments, and usually 1 or 2 questions in the exams are identical to the ones that the professor works through during the lectures. He is a nice knowledgeable prof.

He explains everything in detail and makes it easier for me to learn the contents. He is always on-time, supportive, and very knowledgeable. He is a good teacher to take 232 with. He sometime is late responding emails.

Lectures are not mandatory, yet I found it helpful to attend. Assignments and quizzes were very similar to the midterm exam questions. Clear grading criteria. Standard slides with many examples from last years exams. A supportive and knowlagable teacher, yet TAs not always helpful.

Avoid this person at all costs, he simply does not want to work. I do not understand why he puts so little effort into making this course convenient for everyone. He would always come to class late, his slides were disorganized and he would finish them early, probably because he was tired. Although, I'm sure he's knowledgable, he cant teach

Attendance isn't mandatory, and I would go because I wanted to do well in the course, but I decided to stop and teach myself becuas of his slides stright out of the texbook, and he has slow, monotone 4 hour lectures. Don't take a classs with him, I taught myself the whole class and did better without attending. He also has a no email policy
He is very kind teacher!! He is good!!

Mehdi is a great choice for this class and explains concepts thoroughly and well. Very helpful assignments that prepare you for exams. If you understand how to do the questions proposed in assignments, you can guarantee an above average grade in this course. Overall, very fair exams and interesting lectures.
Standard PPT, and clear lectures. Mehdi knows the content pretty well and he is good in explaining them. Participation is not mandatory yet I recommend it.

Mehdi is a caring lecturer and he is passionate for teaching stats. He is always prepared for the material and how to communicate it. Lectures are not mandatory, yet he provides more examples during the lectures which you may not find them in the slides posted on canvas. 4 assignments + 5 Quizzes count for almost 50% of the total grade.
worst lecturer in which only a quarter of the class actually attended.
Mehdi reviews many examples during the lectures which help to better digest the content. You do not need to memorize the formulas as a cheatsheet is allowed in the exams.

Mehdi is a very understanding, genuine, and helpful professor who wants to see all of his students succeed, although making 250+ students happy with the course is impossible. Mehdi clearly explains each concept in a straightforward manner. Participation is not mandatory, so you can skip the lectures if you find the slides/text self-explanatory.

Very very poor explanation skills, I feel like I understand the concepts better before he actually starts explaining them. Way too much weight on online quizzes that are rigged anyways because everything's just on chegg.

He refuses to record lectures during a pandemic and you basically need to attend lectures or you will be lost. So, basically if you get covid you will miss a class or two of content. Also he doesn't respond to emails, not because he's bad at it. He has a policy that he does not respond to emails. His voice in monotone and he just lectures the text.

I'm sure Medhi is a nice guy in general, but he lacks many traits that make a good professor. One, he isn't accessible. It's always difficult to get a reply. Two, he mostly reads off the slides. He barely gives examples so get ready to read the book to answer the assignment questions. And three, he gives out information a few hours before the exam.
One of the best professors at SFU. Go through his lecture notes, and you'll do well in this course. All the best.

Nice guy wants class to do well. Lectures are pointless since he just rambles on during the slides; you can get by just reading the textbook which I found more helpful. He goes over how to use excel and some question examples in lecture which is the thing to pay attention to. He NEVER replies to emails. NOT accessible outside of class.

Workload is a lot which is normal for 4units. Mehdi is a nice guy but a little out of touch with reality. Monotonous lecturing coupled with mandatory (synched with quiz, technically it is) attendance is a pain. Need lots of practice. Hi-stakes assignments with 1 attempt so you cant learn from your mistakes w/c may just be decimals but who knows.

This class is online and asynchronous for a reason, but he made attending lectures mandatory in order to do the quiz, which btw was 12 minutes for 15 questions. Changed the grading scheme midway through the semester and made assignment questions worth a ridiculous number of marks if you got the wrong answer. There are better profs.

Mehdi is a nice guy with a kind heart, but not the best prof. lectures consist of him reading off slides, but its the workload that makes it a hell mouth. weekly assignments worth 7% each will take you HOURS ON HOURS, and quizzes are 12 mins for 15 questions which will leave you sweating like a dog. only take this class with 2 other ones.

Mehdi is a good professor, however, his assignments were extremely long compared to the other 232 professors. His exams were quite fair and the average was higher than what I usually heard for 232. He went back on his grading system by changing the online quizzes to be done viz zoom proctoring and made them worth 15% less (added to assignments).

Assignments are way too long and too hard and he does not provide enough time to complete them. Only take this course with him if you have low course load. Does not provide enough time on quizzes and exams. Lectures are just him reading off the slide. Be prepared to self-learn everything.
Does not give enough time to complete quizzes, assignments, and homework. He is inaccessible to reach and in lecture all he does is read over slides.

He seems nice and knows the content well. What is bad is his due dates are way too early. He acts like this is the only course we are taking. I recommend not taking him unless you have a medium level course load (2-3 other classes in which are easy)

This professor's teaching method is full of flaws. The practice questions he gave to us were useless and wasted our time working on them. Cut half of the lecture time and make the exam way harder. No rely on emails. No rubric for projects. Everyone can cheat on Final, just typing the questions on Google.
SFU should raise the standards when hiring the professor!

Really have no idea why a person like him can be a professor. Make a Whatsapp group, pretending to be caring. Wrote an exam just before the test date. Took his whole life to mark the team projects. Put useless practice questions to mislead the students.

This guy is just a joke! What he did was also ridiculous, no specific rubric for the group assignments. The exam is pretty unfair, final can be done by searching the questions via Google. Glad he was fired!
He's honestly just awesome. Highly recommend him. He clearly loves his job and is good at dumbing it down for students who haven't really taken any stats courses.
Worst professor ever!!!!!!

Honestly, the course is curved so just make sure to do all of the practice questions he assigns and go to class. The content itself is easy. Don't leave everything to last-second and sleep the night before the exam. Exams are generally pretty easy to finish in time if you do this. Great person. No textbook.
SFU finally changed my grade after 1 month. Nate's grade had a problem and about 75% students got affected. His grading wasn't fair at all.
I'm glad SFU cancelled his contract. Doesn't deserve to be a prof. Pretty immature for a prof. A bit too disorganised. Don't get swayed by his cool character.

Nate spent more effort trying to lower the curve than actually teach this semester. No rubric or anything given for term project and he took forever to mark. Asked for feedback and he had nothing to say.

This guy took 2 months to return project grades which were worth 25% of the grade. The exam that questions were taken from online testbanks and nothing like the practice. Doesn't hold office hours, exams are unfair, and straight-up ignore people when they confront him. Luckily others wont have to suffer as he wont be teaching at SFU
I just want to know is it fine for Nate home's wireless network??????? Three months to mark the project, one week to answer my question on Whatsapp

He is a nice guy, but his lectures are very terrible and disorganized. He emphasized concept testing and understanding but this is a statistical course. He should focus more on calculations and logical deductions, these practical things. I think he went the wrong way to test students. Also, the practice questions he gave us are pretty useless.

Most questions on the final exam can be easily found on google. That is very unfair for students who did final themselves. He said he was upholding academic integrity which is why it took so long for him to mark the projects. But he did not do the same thing on examination or that was just an excuse? SFU canceled contract with him, he deserved it.

This professor is by far the most inefficient one I have ever met at SFU. It takes him three months to mark the projects. He always has excuses like he said he needed to check academic honesty. But he can let TA help him mark together. He is just unable to mark them on time. His lectures are also VERY VERY disorganized. It is very terrible.

Didn't answer my questions during the lecture. Marked assignments months after they were handed in. Lecture material doesn't match assessments. It was a very frustrating semester. Overall good guy, but I don't feel prepared for BUS 336 and I don't feel like I got the most out of that course (BUS 232) I could have with a different prof

Disorganized prof. Makes his midterm and finals the night before! Also, his questions are from a test bank you can easily find online... Also the questions he made himself have incorrect answers because he makes the exams the night before. DO NOT TAKE HIM!

His exams are not similar to the lectures and the given practice questions. His teaching is unclear and it's hard to understand what he said. He hasn't marked the assignments that we gave at least 2 months ago and he didn't give any feedback for us to improve. Not recommend if you want to study properly.

Nathaniel Payne was by far the worst professor that I've had at SFU. His inability to get marking done on time, as well as the fact that his exam formats enabled cheaters to get higher marks on both midterm and final exams, is inexcusable. Steer clear of this professor.
Advice for all future students: GOOGLE THE QUESTIONS DURING THE EXAM. All the questions and answers were straight from Google so you better take advantage of that ;)

If you want to actually learn and have a shot at getting a decent grade, take it with a different prof. Nate is very unorganized and his lectures do not reflect what is going to be on the exams. The term has gone by and we still don't know how we did on our projects. Super unprofessional.

Lectures are good for understanding the projects, but useless for exams. When we brought this up to him he just kept saying his Qs were fair! Never gave us relevant resources or told us how to prepare for concept-based Qs even after being asked multiple times. Only taught 2/4 weekly lecture hours (should have used time to go over concepts).

Lectures are honestly useless, I completely learned from the textbook (which he never references). There were questions on one of the midterms with wrong answers that we asked to be fixed, he will not tell us which questions are incorrect before the final because he "had a multi-hour lecture session going over it", yet there were no recordings.

THIS GUY IS THE ABSOLUTE WORST PROF NO SLIDES AND NO THEORY OR "CONCEPTUAL LEARNING" IN LECTURE. HE SAID ALL EXAMS ARE BASED ON CALCULATIONS AT THE BEGINNING BUT AT THE END HE SAID NO CALCULATIONS. HE HASNT GIVEN BACK OUR ASSIGNMENTS THAT WERE HANDED IN JUNE 23 ( TWO MONTHS AGO)!!!!!!! WORST PROF 10/10 WILL NOT recommend

My opinion on Nate did a full 180. Seemed like a nice guy at first and was responsive in the Whatsapp group but, the midterms were more theory than calculations, the opposite of what he claimed. Additionally, the first part of 3 part project (which was submitted Jun23) is yet to be marked, we handed in the other parts without feedback.

During the first day he said the exams were all practical, calculation based, and such that he gives out a ton of questions on said calculations. That's fine, but when exam day came, it was packed with the theory which he never taught. He doesn't admit fault but doubles down as says "it's conceptual". On top a 3 part assignment with zero marks back

I will never take another class with him. His exams are not similar to the practice questions (made by him) at all. We were forced to submit three parts of a project without even getting a feedback on the previous parts. He only communicates on WhatsApp, and most of the times he replies after several days.

The professor uses WhatsApp as his only method of communication and will not answer questions or only gives very vague responses. The semester is almost over and we have not had any of our assignments graded. I encourage more students to escalate their complaints further with the Business Department.

This guy is a joke. Gives you the impression that he cares but really doesn't. Lectures are a joke, all over the place and so disorganized. Gives out practice problems without solutions and exams are nothing like what the questions he assigns. Doesn't hold office hours and reply to email. This guy's gotta go. Worst prof i've had. AVOID
The worst prof I've ever had at SFU. Made excuses all term about why we haven't received our marks back yet, even though the term is about to be over.

Nate is a flat-out liar. We've been waiting two months to get one component of our project graded, and his excuse was "there were issues with academic dishonesty". Man you've had two months to figure it out. Exams are beyond unfair, he cuts class an hour early each time. His WhatsApp group is a joke, he always ignores people's questions.

Broke our group project into 3 sections, but has yet to mark the first one we submitted 2 months ago. Class ends early, his excuses are not valid. Provides practice problems without answers. Problems are not theory based, but then makes the midterm theory based. Absolute horrible class notes. Do not, I repeat, do not take this class with him.

Nate is one of the worst profs Ive had. Whenever you ask him for something he defers it to a later date and never delivers on his promises. Class is scheduled for 4 hours but likes to wrap it up in 2. Doesnt hold office hours.. Weve had various project submissions due throughout the term and he hasnt marked anything. Exams are a joke.

Nate's academic credentials mean nothing when he is incapable of staying true to his words such as showing grades or his grading criteria. He gives out practice questions that are completely "practical" based and but then on the exams, he expects you to answer "conceptual-based" questions which are 90% of the exam. Any other prof is better than him

Nate has done a poor job. He said that practice problems are reflective of what the exams will be like but then on exam 2, 90% of the questions were "conceptual" questions. Nate also says he will post recordings/review/hw feedback but never does and when students ask about it, he will ignore it. He comes late to class and sometimes even skips class

We are meant to have two 2-hour lectures a week. Each one ends up being an hour long so why am I paying for 4 hours a week when he only teaches 2? He always reiterates "this is a practical class. As long as you are proficient with the practice problems youll do really well". Well thats a lie as doing practice problems prepared you for 5% of MT#2.

Absolute joke of a prof. He ends a two hour class after 45 mins because "he has stuff to do". Yeah Nate, you do. It's called teaching us. The fact that we're paying our hard-earned money for this man is bizarre. He doesn't respond to WhatsApp near the due date of the project, vague guidelines, and don't get me started on his exams. Horrible.
Nate is all over the place and "doesn't test theory" but then proceeds to make his exams all theory. Practice problems are a waste of time and do not prepare you for his exams.
Dont take it with Nate

What comes up on his test is very vague. The practice he gave us suddenly became totally useless after one midterm because turns out this midterm is theory-based rather than practical-based. Theory-wised, his lectures are really hard to understand and too messy. Recently, he barely wrote any notes and would only narrate over course materials.

Just did his midterm. It was mediocre at best. Like ??? he constantly says during lecture "I am all about you solving questions and having a practical application on my exams. But then what happens? 97% of the questions on the exam are all theory questions and you need to have a strong understanding of the theory to solve the questions. like ??????

Don't understand why his rating is poor? He is different from the traditional way of teaching as he does not follow the book/slide that he provided, but he clearly stated those are for reference only. As long as you attend his lectures, do the practice Qs and try to keep track of the Whatsapp chat, the exam is extremely similar to his class!

Nate is super amazing prof. I am not the best at numeracy, I didn't spend too much time and still get A+. Nate is helpful and patient to answer our questions even students ask him the same things a thousand times. Just go to lectures, do practice questions, sometimes catch up on Whatsapp group. Exams are EXACTLY similar to what he taught

Amazing proff! His lectures are clear and straight to the point. He is great at making sure he answers all of our questions and his group projects are straight forward. You can easily succeed in this class if you pay attention to lectures and do all of the practice questions, he usually goes over practice questions in class as well.

Took bus 232 online with him and he must be the least organized professor out there. No clear study guide, messy lectures that dont correspond to the book or slides. You basically have three different materials the slides, the book, and his lectures which are all unrelated. His exams are extremely unfair too with too many non of the above choices.

On top of being an exceptional lecturer, Prof Nate is also an extremely impressive individual. If you want to learn the material in a comprehensive way and be inspired for the future at the same time, take his class.

I had Nate a year ago for Bus 232 and I loved his enthusiasm. You could tell he was passionate about stats as this was felt by the class and made it fun. He's a busy guy so be patient but if you want to learn he's there for you! I will definitely take the next required stats class with him

Love this prof. He cares about all his students and even made a Whatsapp group so we can ask questions. He gives a lot of examples so you just have to listen in class and you will know exactly what to except for midterms and finals. However, his notes will ONLY make sense if you go to lecture. If you skip class then it can be a difficult class.

Trust me, dont do that!!! He taught some that the another prof didnt mention, and his teaching style is a little bit indescribable. This course is easy but he can make it difficult. Easy to pass, but hard to get A.

His notes are very messy. He post them onto the Whatsapp group, but he doesn't take it seriously at all. His notes are often not in the right order and upside down. It's a pain to look through every note to make it into the right order because other students send pics into the group. He also never replies to messages. No feedback on projects. Avoid

The curve of this course is very high. The professor can not be blamed for that. However the professor at times rushed over some material. For example the anova table for us in bus 232. My grade suffered due to that. I got about 80% but ended up with a C+. Again cant blame the prof just how the curve works. The prof was okay better than others tho!

never reply emailnever give feedback to studentgroup assignment is so difficultthis course is easybut professor give only a few a levelnever take this professors courseso bad i never see beforeHis exam is not correlation with his teach in class

Good prof even with COVID-19 going on. His assignments are super open-ended giving you freedom on how you want to analyze a dataset. If you dont goto class and pay attention you will fall behind. Everything that is on his exams was taught during lecture and on practice problems. Goto class and practice and youll easily do well.
extremely disorganized. Assignments are not done properly and changes everything last minute. He makes you think he's a good prof but is terrible at giving feedback. I would not recommend.

caring and very kind
Lectures are somewhat boring and sleepy but if you pay attention, it's understandable
Exams are the same as practice questions, so practice as much as you can, and mcqs just remember it
The rest: depends on your luck and the curve of the class
She is a great processor and understands the material she's teaching. Exams are fair.

She's very through and her course material preps you well for exams. Homework can be a little tough since they wont tell you what you got right or wrong until everything is submitted. Most exam questions are similar to practice problems so if you put in the effort, you'll do well.
Michael is a nice guy and very helpful prof. His lecture is clear and he always finishes earlier. I made a mistake not taking 336 with him.
Dobson is the worst prof, bad teaching style, really rude when you ask him question. Not recommand!!! I Take Bus 336 with Michael Johnson!!!Awesome Prof!!! I regret take Bus232 with Dobson
Terrible prof. He takes forever to start talking about the material and wastes half the class blabbing about how great it's going to be. Avoid him if possible.
Know your theory for MT and final.  I cannot stress enough.   Everything else is easy.
